      • scaleToUnit

        public static double[] scaleToUnit(double[] a,
                   IntervalDouble r)
        Scales each value to the range [0 ,1], using the given Interval.
        Parameters:
        a - The array to scale the values in (the values in this array are altered).
        r - The Interval to use, this range should encompass all the values in the array.
        Returns:
        The given array with scaled values.

      • scaleFromUnit

        public static double[] scaleFromUnit(double[] a,
                     IntervalDouble r)
        Scales each value in the array to the given.
        Parameters:
        a - The array to scale the values in (the values in this array are altered). All values should be in the range [0, 1].
        r - The Interval to use to scale the values with.
        Returns:
        The given array with scaled values.

      • pack

        public static double[] pack(double[][] unpacked)
        Returns a new array that is the result of row-packing the given 2D array into a 1D array.

        unpack(double[], int, int, int)

      • pack

        public static double[] pack(double[][] unpacked,
            double[] packed)
        Row-packs the values in the given 2D array into the given 1D array.
        Parameters:
        unpacked - The unpacked array.
        packed - The array to copy the result into.
        Returns:
        a reference to the array passed in for parameter packed.
        See Also:
        unpack(double[], int, int, int)

      • unpack

        public static double[][] unpack(double[] packed,
                int width,
                int height,
                int outputIndex)
        Returns a new array that is the result of unpacking the given 1D array into a 2D array, row-first.
        Parameters:
        packed - The packed array.
        width - The width, or number of columns, in the unpacked array.
        height - The height, or number of rows, in the unpacked array.
        outputIndex - The index to start reading from in the packed array.
        See Also:
        pack(double[][])

      • unpack

        public static double[][] unpack(double[] packed,
                double[][] unpacked,
                int outputIndex)
        Unpacks the values in the given 1D array into the given 2D array, row-first.
        Parameters:
        packed - The packed array.
        unpacked - an array to copy the result into. Should have dimensions [height/rows][width/columns].
        outputIndex - The index to start reading from in the packed array.
        Returns:
        a reference to the array passed in for parameter unpacked.
        See Also:
        pack(double[][])

      • distance

        public static double distance(double[] a,
              double[] b)
        Calculates the distance between two points represented by (n-dimensional) vectors.

      • newRandomIndexing

        public static int[] newRandomIndexing(int size,
                      java.util.Random random)
        Creates a new array containing every integer value in the range [0, size) in a random order. All permutations occur with equal likelihood assuming that the source of randomness is fair.

      • multiply

        public static double[] multiply(double[] a,
                double m)
        Multiply each element in the given array by the given factor. The original array is returned with altered values.
